snippet: A former police officer convicted of raping and sexually victimizing women while on his beat in a low-income Oklahoma City neighborhood was ordered to spend the rest of his life in prison.
abstract: Former Oklahoma City Police Officer Daniel Holtzclaw is sentenced to 263 years in prison for raping and sexually victimizing black women in low-income neighborhood in city in 2013 and 2014.
lead_paragraph: A former police officer convicted of raping and sexually victimizing women while on his beat in a low-income Oklahoma City neighborhood was ordered to spend the rest of his life in prison.

headline.main: Oklahoma: Ex-Officer Gets 263 Years in Rapes
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma: Ex-Officer Gets 263 Years in Rapes
